summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting the interview of Janusz Banasiak, a former household employee of Jeffrey Epstein. Banasiak describes his hiring process, job duties, the household manual, message logs, and his awareness of the investigation and Epstein's guilty plea. The interview was conducted to gather evidence and corroborate details about Epstein's operations.

persons.name: Janusz Banasiak
persons.role: Former household employee of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Interviewed by the FBI about his employment with Jeffrey Epstein from 2005 to 2017. He describes his duties, the household manual, and his reaction to Epstein's arrest and guilty plea.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation. Banasiak describes working for him, his travel habits, his demeanor with staff, and the aftermath of his arrest and guilty plea for solicitation of underage prostitution.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Interviewed Banasiak for a job in her New York townhouse and was a primary source of instructions for him regarding Epstein's preferences and household operations.

persons.name: Chela
persons.context: Name appears in a message log entry dated 2/4/05 that Banasiak recognized as his own handwriting.

persons.name: Dr. Garecki
persons.context: Name appears in a message log entry dated 2/18/05 that Banasiak recognized as his own handwriting.

persons.name: Jeff Stely
persons.context: Name appears in a message log entry dated 3/18/05 that Banasiak recognized as his own handwriting.

persons.name: George Dawson
persons.context: Name appears in a message log entry dated 4/10/05 that Banasiak recognized as his own handwriting.

persons.name: Tony
persons.context: Name appears in a message log entry dated 8/20/05 that Banasiak recognized as his own handwriting.

connections.description: Banasiak was employed by Epstein from 2005 to 2017 as a household manager and driver.
Maxwell interviewed Banasiak for the job and was a primary point of contact for instructions regarding Epstein's household.
Maxwell was involved in hiring staff for Epstein and managing aspects of his household operations.

events.title: Banasiak begins employment
events.description: Janusz Banasiak is hired through an agency, interviewed by Ghislaine Maxwell and then Jeffrey Epstein, and moves to Florida to work on Epstein's property.

events.title: Message log entries
events.description: Banasiak identifies numerous messages he wrote in household message books, documenting calls for Epstein.

events.title: Police search warrant executed
events.description: Police arrived at Epstein's Florida property with a search warrant while Banasiak was present. He learned of the investigation against Epstein at this time.

events.title: Epstein's guilty plea and jail sentence
events.description: Banasiak learned from news reports that Epstein pleaded guilty to solicitation of underage prostitution and went to jail. He drove Epstein to court for his appearance.

events.title: Banasiak ends employment
events.description: Banasiak stopped working for Epstein, having stayed through Epstein's jail sentence despite considering leaving.

locations: New York house (between Lexington Avenue and Park Avenue, townhouse)
Epstein's office on Madison Avenue, New York
keyFacts: Janusz Banasiak worked for Jeffrey Epstein from 2005 to 2017 as a household manager and driver, living in a small house on Epstein's Florida property.
Banasiak was interviewed and hired by Ghislaine Maxwell, who provided detailed instructions on Epstein's preferences and household protocols via a household manual.
Banasiak identified his handwriting in extensive message logs from 2005, showing his role in managing communications for Epstein.
Banasiak first learned of the investigation into Epstein when police executed a search warrant at the Florida property.
Banasiak confirmed Epstein's guilty plea to solicitation of underage prostitution, which he learned from news reports, and stated Epstein cut employee pay by 10% after his arrest.
